text: Problem 10.12 A piece of wire bent into a loop, as shown in Fig. 10.5, carries a current that increases linearly with time: I(t) =kt (—o0 <t < 00). Calculate the retarded vector potential A at the center. Find the electric field at the center. Why does this (neutral) wire produce an electric field? (Why can’t you determine the magnetic field from this expression for A?)
